inputs.name: min-wrapper-count
inputs.description: Minimum number expected gradle-wrapper.jar files found in the repository. Non-negative number. Higher number is useful in monorepos where each project might have their own wrapper.

inputs.name: allow-snapshots
inputs.description: Allow Gradle snapshot versions during checksum verification. Boolean, true or false.

inputs.name: allow-checksums
inputs.description: Accept arbitrary user-defined checksums as valid. Comma separated list of SHA256 checksums (lowercase hex).

outputs.name: failed-wrapper
outputs.description: The path of the Gradle Wrapper(s) JAR that failed validation. Path is a platform-dependent relative path to git repository root. Multiple paths are separated by a | character.

evidence.reasoning: The action validates Gradle Wrapper JAR files, which is primarily related to ensuring code quality and correctness in dependency management. It also plays a role in testing the integrity of the build environment.
